Package Utils

Class SceneLoader

java.lang.Object
Utils.SceneLoader
public class SceneLoader extends Object
A class for conveniently navigating between views.

  • Method Details

    • goToLoginView

      public static void goToLoginView(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage) throws Exception
      Loads the view for the login page
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - - set to the login page
      Throws:
      Exception - - throws exception if /View/login.fxml cannot be found

    • goToMainView

      public static void goToMainView(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This function is called many times throughout the application whenever the user wants to navigate back to the main application view. In the main view on the left column is the table of all Customers from the database and below that table is a set of buttons for manipulating Customers from that table. In the right column is the table of all Appointments from the database and below that table is a set of buttons for manipulating Appointments from that table.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - passed to FXML Loader
      Throws:
      IOException - - throws if fxml file not found

    • goToAddCustomerView

      public static void goToAddCustomerView(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This function is called after the user clicks the "Add" button underneath the Customers table and open a view where the user can add all necessary information to create their new Customer to add to the database.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - passed to FXML Loader
      Throws:
      IOException - - throws if fxml file not found

    • goToModifyCustomerView

      public static void goToModifyCustomerView(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Called after the user clicks the "Modify" button underneath the Customers table. If a Customer is selected it will open a new view where the user can edit the selected Customer. If no Customer is selected the app will display a warning dialog indicating that the user needs to select a Customer to modify.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - passed to FXML Loader
      Throws:
      IOException - - throws if fxml file not found

    • goToAddAppointmentView

      public static void goToAddAppointmentView(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Called after the user clicks the "Add" button underneath the Appointments table. It opens a new view where the user can enter all the information needed to create a new Appointment.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - passed to FXML Loader
      Throws:
      IOException - - throws if fxml file not found

    • goToModifyAppointmentView

      public static void goToModifyAppointmentView(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Called when the user clicks the "Modify" button under the Appointments table.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - passed to FXML Loader
      Throws:
      IOException - - throws if fxml file not found

    • goToCustomerReportsView

      public static void goToCustomerReportsView(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      When the customer reports button is clicked a new view will appear that allows the user to select a customer and see in a text format a report that shows all the appointments in the database for that customer.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - passed to FXML Loader
      Throws:
      IOException - - throws if fxml file not found

    • goToAppointmentReportsView

      public static void goToAppointmentReportsView(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Called when the user clicks the "Reports" button underneath the appointments table
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - passed to FXML Loader
      Throws:
      IOException - - throws if fxml file not found
